title: Rap111
author: Rap111
content: Hello Bitcointalk, Dear Members, do you know a pre-sale token with solid connections that you can recommend? I'm Thinking About Making an Investment

comments.author: Kavelj22
comments.body: Quote from: Rap111 on October 21, 2023, 08:53:34 AMHello Bitcointalk, Dear Members, do you know a pre-sale token with solid connections that you can recommend? I'm Thinking About Making an InvestmentI do not advise you to ever bet on any of the projects that are launched from an ICO campaign. This type of project proved to be a failure from the end of 2017 to the beginning of 2018, which was the period in which these campaigns flourished. In the end what happened? More than 99 percent of these projects failed and collapsed, including those projects that succeeded in being listed on one of the trading platforms.Why not invest in Bitcoin? It is always the safest option.Or you may be looking to make a quick profit in the short term. I advise you to invest in one of the solid projects that have proven their efficiency over time. I cannot direct you to specific options, and therefore you will have to choose for yourself according to the research that I advise you to do before venturing into investing in any project.

comments.author: MAAManda
comments.body: Quote from: Rap111 on October 21, 2023, 08:53:34 AMHello Bitcointalk, Dear Members, do you know a pre-sale token with solid connections that you can recommend? I'm Thinking About Making an InvestmentI wouldn't recommend any pre-sales here, as most of them are just rubbish that come and go quickly. So, it's better to avoid them all except tokens that are at L-1 or L-2, they look more promising.Then, you said that you wanted to make an investment, right? investments are usually made over the long term, so wouldn't it be better for you to buy Bitcoin (BTC) for the purpose of holding it in the long term? after all, we're due for a halving in a few months.

comments.author: $crypto$
comments.body: Quote from: Rap111 on October 21, 2023, 08:53:34 AMHello Bitcointalk, Dear Members, do you know a pre-sale token with solid connections that you can recommend? I'm Thinking About Making an InvestmentYou are thinking of investment, means you should avoid pre-sale this will be more loss than gain, is it because you think by investing in pre-sale get higher digs because the token will go up? Not like that my friend, we don't recommend any coin unless you intend to invest in bitcoin.I'm sure many people will come to this thread to advise you not to put money in the pre-sale because it will clearly be detrimental, just choose bitcoin your investment will be safe and never scam like tokens that are in the pre-sale.

comments.author: Xal0lex
comments.body: Quote from: Rap111 on October 21, 2023, 08:53:34 AMHello Bitcointalk, Dear Members, do you know a pre-sale token with solid connections that you can recommend? I'm Thinking About Making an InvestmentAre you going to invest your money on the recommendations of people you don't know at all? It is highly likely that you will lose your money on such investments. If you don't understand what to buy and how to buy, then exactly the same way you won't understand when and what to sell. Start by studying the market and just buy bitcoin. With a 99.99% probability you are not ready to invest in the altcoin market.

comments.author: Husires
comments.body: Technical analysis indicators for Bitcoin show that we may not see the price of $30,000 again after several months, and we will never see it again at all. Therefore, it is an almost guaranteed opportunity for those who want to invest within 6 months or even for a longer period and aim to achieve a profit or at least double the investment amount.If the option of investing in Bitcoin is so attractive and there are no real guarantees that investing in pre-sale token will achieve profits in exchange for a high probability of achieving losses, then betting on Bitcoin will be the best option.

comments.author: Silberman
comments.body: Quote from: Rap111 on October 21, 2023, 08:53:34 AMHello Bitcointalk, Dear Members, do you know a pre-sale token with solid connections that you can recommend? I'm Thinking About Making an InvestmentLook, I can understand some people may look at this market and see the profits other forum members have gotten over the years and think they want some of those profits for themselves, but you are going the wrong way about this, you know nothing about this market or about investing in general, and despite your ignorance you insist on investing on this market by relying on the kindness of a bunch of people you do not know, and if you elect to continue on this path you will either get scammed or lose it all anyway due to your incompetence.

comments.author: Taskford
comments.body: Quote from: Rap111 on October 21, 2023, 08:53:34 AMHello Bitcointalk, Dear Members, do you know a pre-sale token with solid connections that you can recommend? I'm Thinking About Making an InvestmentCan't recommend you to anything like that since honestly even those presale token show some solid partnership they still fall into a category as scam. So maybe try to learn trade those existing solid coins since this is much better investment rather than trying to risk on those new tokens and try to go first to sell or else your doomed. People already have bad experience thru this type of investment so maybe its ideal if you could learn from them and didn't come to learn from your experience since it might cost you a lot of money for taking those mistakes.I know its hard to learn trading but consistency beat all odds and you will learn it for long time learning its process.

comments.author: TimeTeller
comments.body: Quote from: Taskford on October 21, 2023, 11:42:07 PMQuote from: Rap111 on October 21, 2023, 08:53:34 AMHello Bitcointalk, Dear Members, do you know a pre-sale token with solid connections that you can recommend? I'm Thinking About Making an InvestmentCan't recommend you to anything like that since honestly even those presale token show some solid partnership they still fall into a category as scam. So maybe try to learn trade those existing solid coins since this is much better investment rather than trying to risk on those new tokens and try to go first to sell or else your doomed. People already have bad experience thru this type of investment so maybe its ideal if you could learn from them and didn't come to learn from your experience since it might cost you a lot of money for taking those mistakes.I know its hard to learn trading but consistency beat all odds and you will learn it for long time learning its process.As you said, better look for solid coins before going into new projects, which most of them have very short lifespan.If the OP is indeed a newbie in this market, should start from top alts as they have solid ground already.He will likely lose if he will try to buy those pre-sale tokens, because most of them won't even hit the trading market, as they will be abandoned by their respective creators.

comments.author: LogitechMouse
comments.body: Quote from: Rap111 on October 21, 2023, 08:53:34 AMHello Bitcointalk, Dear Members, do you know a pre-sale token with solid connections that you can recommend? I'm Thinking About Making an InvestmentNone.Investing in a project that's on a pre-sale, or in short a new project has the highest risk. They can build a project, launch a pre-sale, and when they got enough money, they can just run away alongside with your money. I guess this is also the reason why I didn't invest into new projects so much especially in 2018 where new projects are being launched every day thru ICO's. I tried 2x I guess, and both failed. If you're thinking of making an investment, why not invest into established coins already? If you want to make an investment, why choose those start-up projects? I mean we the profit might be lower when you invest into those top market cap coins, but the risk is also lower as well. If you want to risk your money then go with these pre-sale tokens, but we can't recommend, or at least I can't recommend any project that has a solid connection towards other influencers. If I were you, I will just put that money into coins that have been there for a long time such as Bitcoin, and even those altcoins like Ethereum.

comments.author: asriloni
comments.body: Quote from: Rap111 on October 21, 2023, 08:53:34 AMHello Bitcointalk, Dear Members, do you know a pre-sale token with solid connections that you can recommend? I'm Thinking About Making an InvestmentI cannot really advise you at this moment. Just try to join in the launchpad but don't expect you can grab huge allocations of token without having big sum of money to be staked first before the allocation will be determined. The presale and ico were not really hyped again these days. IEO has become a new trend but since there have been many projects prefer to run their projects without even getting to fundraise some money and it's hard to find a legit project to invest these days. Try to find some upcoming IEO through some website like cryptorank. This will be really help you a lot to know that which tokens that is potentially to launch its IEO. You can also try to use some exchange sites which was also regularly launching their IEO.

comments.author: Fundamentals Of
comments.body: I have somehow grown tired of seeing projects conducting ICOs or token pre-sales over the years, gathered money from investors like you, and ended up with nothing. If they're not total frauds, they're shabby projects that are not worth any investment. There may be a new project or two which rises above the rest, but hitting the perfect one among a vast ocean of frauds is not easy. Especially for a newbie, it isn't advisable. The risk is so high in this kind of investment. You better use your money buying Bitcoin or ETH and other top altcoins.

comments.author: abel1337
comments.body: Quote from: Rap111 on October 21, 2023, 08:53:34 AMHello Bitcointalk, Dear Members, do you know a pre-sale token with solid connections that you can recommend? I'm Thinking About Making an InvestmentI would recommend you to don't ask for recommendation here or anywhere about a pre sale token investment. People will just recommend shtty investment or some straight up scam. It's best to do your own research in finding those crowd funding or presale token, though I don't really recommend investing on those since they have a bad history. It would be better to just buy bitcoin or good altcoins that already exist in the market. I believe that it would be the best route for newbies like you.

comments.author: fzkto
comments.body: Quote from: abel1337 on October 22, 2023, 04:15:02 PMQuote from: Rap111 on October 21, 2023, 08:53:34 AMHello Bitcointalk, Dear Members, do you know a pre-sale token with solid connections that you can recommend? I'm Thinking About Making an InvestmentI would recommend you to don't ask for recommendation here or anywhere about a pre sale token investment. People will just recommend shtty investment or some straight up scam. It's best to do your own research in finding those crowd funding or presale token, though I don't really recommend investing on those since they have a bad history. It would be better to just buy bitcoin or good altcoins that already exist in the market. I believe that it would be the best route for newbies like you.This is very good advice not to listen to anyone here on the forum or on other social media. Pre-selling tokens is always a very huge risk. So many people have gone through this experience in 2017 and have bad success. That's why something like ICO is very risky right now. It is better to buy time-tested coins and wait for a bull run.

comments.author: crwth
comments.body: For sure there are a lot of projects that you can invest in but you need to make sure that you are going to be careful with what you are picking because it's going to be a risk. If you have the time, you need to research if it's going to be worth it. Imagine just going in because of some stranger who is trying to promote their project. You still need to work on your own research.Check the ANN topics that are projects here in Bitcointalk, you might like something.

comments.author: cheezcarls
comments.body: Quote from: Rap111 on October 21, 2023, 08:53:34 AMHello Bitcointalk, Dear Members, do you know a pre-sale token with solid connections that you can recommend? I'm Thinking About Making an InvestmentI’ll cut right to the chase OP.First of all, we are not financial or investment advisors here. Cryptocurrency projects like in pre-sale are subject to substantial risks and are prone to high volatility due to the unstable and unpredictable market conditions.And not just that, it doesn’t offer any promises or astronomical guaranteed returns. So regardless if the pre-sale has so many partners that doesn’t guarantee you anything about making a profit. In my personal experience, I did participated in many presale campaigns with highly known partners, VCs, etc. However, only a handful of them that I made a profit especially if 100% of the tokens are unlocked during the TGE and with no cliff.And as for the rest? They are under vesting period in an average of 3 months, 6 months, 1 year and more. The problem is that most of the time the prices went downhill even below the seed sale price, in which I have experienced that before. Although that I am not discouraging you because of my experience (nor encouraging you either), but it is better that you should decide by your own instincts and acknowledge the risks no matter what. When you spend that money in the pre-sale, just treat it as “dead money” like you’re just fine affording to lose it. Just my two sats.

comments.author: Wiwo
comments.body: Quote from: Rap111 on October 21, 2023, 08:53:34 AMHello Bitcointalk, Dear Members, do you know a pre-sale token with solid connections that you can recommend? I'm Thinking About Making an InvestmentFirst seeking such advise from the public will only increase your risk of possible investment into be wrong project,  since altcoin general is full with unpredictability also there be measures that must be followed for you to arrive and a good position of opening and investment entry in altcoins direction,  so much so that you have to consider a lot of factors and the various risks. I will not advise anyone to buy into a pre-sale because most times those coins after the ore sale will never make it to the exchange and their investors are made to wait endlessly for when their investment will yield any positive result or ever get the chance to trade the pre-sale tokens since must are not listed. So my best take is to buy some of the few potential altcoins that are already trading in the market and also make sure to check what are their liquidity availability and what ecosystems support them in real life.

comments.author: passwordnow
comments.body: Quote from: Rap111 on October 21, 2023, 08:53:34 AMHello Bitcointalk, Dear Members, do you know a pre-sale token with solid connections that you can recommend? I'm Thinking About Making an InvestmentIf you're thinking of investing, you already can see which is at the top 1 right? I don't recommend getting into pre-sale tokens these days, yes some were successful and they're like a lottery honestly. And that's why if you want to make an investment in the market, choose those that are established already so you won't have any regrets in the end. Many of these pre sale tokens or any type of crowdfunding these days could be at their worst time. But if you're really up on it, this is your first step asking the public about our opinions? You can do more by DYOR and searching for those but if you do that, you're likely to fall on the wrong projects and that is because there's no assurance on them. So we go back to the first suggestion of buying bitcoin, you minimize the risk and you get a more secured investment through it.

comments.author: cryptoaddictchie
comments.body: Quote from: Rap111 on October 21, 2023, 08:53:34 AMHello Bitcointalk, Dear Members, do you know a pre-sale token with solid connections that you can recommend? I'm Thinking About Making an InvestmentAs of this writing the one I knew of with potential presale is dedotfi. With dozens of users and has working product that are very useful for security. I did invest on this. As of now they have 1.7m raise out of 2.5m and currently 3hrs left for the sale period. Not sure what they will do with the unsold tokens but hoping they could burn it or reallocate for potential airdrop.

comments.author: Xal0lex
comments.body: Quote from: crwth on October 22, 2023, 05:09:11 PMCheck the ANN topics that are projects here in Bitcointalk, you might like something. This advice is good, except that the forum very rarely publishes topics with announcements of really top projects. Can you find topics with announcements of, for example, Arbitrum, Aptos, ZkSynk, Starknet? I see publications, mostly of all kinds of garbage projects, which even with the presence of a topic with an announcement cause a clear dislike. The forum is good as a bitcoin knowledge platform, but as for altcoins, it doesn't always support current trends.
